title: Semantic Neural Radiance Fields for Multi-Date Satellite Data
author: Valentin Wagner (Fraunhofer Institute of Optronics), Sebastian Bullinger (Fraunhofer Institute of Optronics), Christoph Bodensteiner (Fraunhofer Institute of Optronics), Michael Arens (Fraunhofer Institute of Optronics), ...
relevance_why: The approach integrates semantic information with neural radiance fields, which could enhance audio-visual applications where spatial understanding and multi-modal integration are important.
background: Generating 3D semantic representations from multi-date satellite images to improve scene understanding in various applications such as urban planning and environmental monitoring.
contribution: This paper introduces a satellite-domain-adapted semantic Neural Radiance Field model that fuses semantic and color information into a unified 3D scene representation, enhancing color consistency and robustness against noisy input labels.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied heavily on explicit representations or lacked integration of semantic data into the 3D reconstruction pipeline, often resulting in inaccuracies due to transient objects.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a dual-modality approach that merges both semantic and RGB information using Neural Radiance Fields to create a more coherent representation.

key_innovation: Combines RGB and semantic data in a way that not only enhances the rendered scene but also introduces a mechanism to improve prediction robustness against noises in satellite data.
real_world_impact: The proposed method can improve environmental analyses and urban planning through better automated monitoring and reconstruction of scenes, providing actionable insights from satellite imagery.
limitations: The approaches primarily focus on static scene reconstruction and may not effectively handle rapidly changing environments.

new_terms.Neural Radiance Fields: **Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF)** are a method for representing 3D scenes as continuous functions trained on 2D images to render novel views.
new_terms.semantic segmentation: **Semantic Segmentation** is a computer vision task that involves classifying each pixel in an image with a corresponding category.

open_sourcing: The code and dataset are available at https://github.com/wagnva/semantic-nerf-for-satellite-data.
